data.Title: Microsoft Partners with StopNCII to Combat Revenge Porn on Bing
data.Description: Microsoft is taking a stand against revenge porn and deepfakes on its Bing search engine. The company has partnered with StopNCII to proactively remove harmful intimate images and videos using digital hashes. This tool allows individuals to create unique identifiers for their sensitive media, enabling Bing to detect and remove non-consensual content.

data.Title: Google August 2024 Core Update Concludes
data.Description: The Google August 2024 core update has finished rolling out after 19 days. Initial observations from SEO professionals indicate a mixed bag of results, with some websites experiencing positive ranking improvements while others saw significant drops. The update, which began on August 15th, has sparked discussions and analysis within the SEO community.

data.Title: OpenAI's SearchGPT Faces Early Criticism
data.Description: OpenAI's SearchGPT, positioned as a potential competitor to Google, is facing scrutiny from early users. While showing promise, the AI-powered search tool reportedly struggles with shopping and local queries.  Additionally, concerns have been raised about SearchGPT's tendency to present inaccurate or fabricated information, highlighting the challenges of developing reliable AI search engines.
